ğŸ“– How to Use Jupyter Notebooks

ğŸ”‘ Most Important Skill: Running Code Cells

  1. Click on a code cell (gray background) - it gets a blue border
  2. Press Shift + Enter - this runs the code
  3. Wait for results - output appears below the cell
  4. Move to next cell - repeat the process

ğŸ“‹ Essential Rules

  • Always go top to bottom - Cells depend on previous cells
  • Read text cells first - They explain what's coming next
  • Run code cells in order - Skipping causes errors
  • When stuck, restart - Kernel â†’ Restart Kernel

ğŸ“š Learning Path

Notebook Level Time Description
00-Getting-Started-TUTORIAL.ipynb Beginner 10 min Jupyter tutorial (start here if new!)
01-Graph-Fundamentals.ipynb Beginner 45 min Security graphs and attack paths
02-Attack-Path-Discovery.ipynb Intermediate 60 min Advanced attack analysis
05-Anomaly-Detection-ML.ipynb Advanced 90 min Machine learning for security

ğŸ”— Connected Learning

ğŸ® Keep These Open While Learning:

ğŸ†˜ Troubleshooting

Common Issues & Solutions:

â“ "Code won't run"
â†’ Click on the cell first (blue border), then Shift + Enter

â“ "Variable undefined error"
â†’ Run cells from top to bottom in order

â“ "Notebook seems frozen"
â†’ Go to Kernel menu â†’ Restart Kernel

â“ "Can't connect to database"
â†’ Make sure Docker is running: docker-compose up -d
